caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 60.
Caecum mirificum
. A . Profile view (LACM 1975-54.29). B . Profile view (SBMNH 128136). C . Ventral view (LACM 1975-54.29). D . Operculum, exterior surface (SBMNH 149034). E . Operculum, interior surface (SBMNH 149034). F . Lectotype, MNHN-IM-2000-4592. G . Close-up of periostracum (SBMNH 149034). H . Profile view with periostracum (SBMNH 149034). I . Profile view without periostracum (LACM 1975-54.29). J . Close-up of surface sculpture (LACM 1975- 54.29).

FIGURE 61.
Caecum mirificum
shells at different growth stages. A . teleoconchs II to IV (LACM 1964-31.25). B . Teleoconch IV (SBMNH 620588). C . Surface of teleoconch II (LACM 1964-31.25). D . Surface of teleoconch III (LACM 1964-31.25). E . Teleoconch V (SBMNH 128136). F . Surface of teleoconch IV (LACM 1964-31.25). G . Surface of teleoconchs V to VI (SBMNH 128136). H . Teleoconch VI (LACM 1975-54.29).

subSubSection.paragraph: Original diagnosis. “Testa (quoad genus) maxima, valde elongata, cylindrica, crystallina, nitidissima, liris subacute-rotundatis, aequidistantibus, leviter expressis, longitudinaliter notata, et annulis paucis, validis, acutis, super liras transeuntibus aperturam versus cingulata; inter liras interstitiis latis, transversim minutissime striatis; apertura paululum contracta, subdeclivi, marginata; septo mamillato, granuloso, prominente, apice obtuso, dextrorso, margine laterali valde convexo subcirculari; operculo?” de Folin (1867a: 47) .

Distribution and Habitat. From Cedros Island, Baja California , Mexico to Tumbes , Peru , including the Gulf of California, the Revillagigedo Islands, Cocos Island, and the Galapagos Islands. Intertidal to
122 m .
Uncommon on sand and rubble substrates.

Remarks. The type material of
Caecum mirificum
is comprised of three subadults and one adult specimen. For taxonomic stability a lectotype is herein designated (MNHN-IM-2000-4592, Fig. 60F ).
Caecum mirificum
has a thick periostracum, which at times can even appear fur-like ( Figs. 60 G–H).
